casebody.data:
INTERSAL, INC.
v.
HAMILTON, et al. 115A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. October 12, 2018 David H. Harris, Jr., Attorney at Law, Durham, for Intersal, Inc. Brian Rabinovitz, Special Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Special Deputy Attorney General, Amar Majmundar, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Charles G. Whitehead, Special Deputy Attorney General, for North Carolina Department of Natural and Cultural Resources, et al. Jeffrey A. Doyle, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Joshua D. Neighbors, Attorney at Law, for Friends of Queen Anne's Revenge (Non-Profit Corporation)

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 9th of October 2018 by Plaintiff for Extension of Time to Respond to State Defendants' Motion to Dismiss Appeal:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 12th of October 2018."

Plaintiff shall have up to and including the 19th day of October 2018 to Respond to Motion to Dismiss.
